titleproper.value: Guide to the Gina Johnson Riot Grrrl Zines <num>MSS.524</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-02-09T19:10:10</date>

abstract.value: The Gina Johnson Riot Grrrl Zines collection contains materials gathered by Johnson for her research as a graduate student in the early to mid-1990s. Johnson collected a number of zines revolving around the Riot Grrrl movement during this time to support her research interests. This collection consists of issues of Riot Grrrl zines, such as <emph render="italic">My Last Nerve</emph>, <emph render="italic">Wild Honey Pie</emph>, and <emph render="italic">The Nerdy Grrrl Revolution</emph>. The selected zines combine illustrations, personal narratives, poetry, reviews, and social criticism centering around issues of gender, race, sexuality, and equality. The collection ranges from 1993 to 1995.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Gina Johnson Riot Grrrl Zines; MSS 524; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Donated by Gina Johnson-Cuomo in November 2017.

Gina Johnson-Cuomo (n√©e Gina Johnson) became interested in the Riot Girl movement in the 1990s. While in graduate school, she made the Riot Grrrl movement the subject of her graduate research. During this period, she collected zines published by women participating in the movement and used the materials for her research.

This collection consists of materials collected by Gina Johnson-Cuomo from the early to mid-1990s documenting her research interest in the Riot Grrrl movement. Materials include issues of Riot Grrrl zines, such as <emph render="italic">My Last Nerve</emph>, <emph render="italic">Wild Honey Pie</emph>, and <emph render="italic">The Nerdy Grrrl Revolution</emph>. The zines combine illustrations, personal narratives, poetry, reviews, and social criticism centering around issues of gender, race, sexuality, and equality. The collection ranges from 1993 to 1995.
